intro: Solenophora purpusii, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, hibiscus-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. It has palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Solenophora purpusii plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
